Name: Runebound Essential Collection
Description:
The lands of Terrinoth seem to cry out for adventure...and adventure is never long to answer. Heroes and villains clash upon these lands to forge legendary tales that will live on in the campfires and bard’s songs of tomorrow. Many have come before you to set out on that open path, and many have failed. Do you have what it takes to become a legend of Terrinoth?

This box of adventure contains six previously released expansions for Runebound, now available in one convenient and specially priced package. Featuring six single deck expansions, consisting of Adventure variants, Challenge cards, Items, and Allies, the Essential Collection is a great way to breathe new life into this beloved game of fantasy adventure.

The Essential Collection contains two new Adventure variants for Runebound, telling the tales of The Cataclysm and The Seven Scions. With cursed stars falling from the sky and the threat of the Stormlords invading Terrinoth, heroes are needed more than ever! Each of these Adventure variants are comprised of new game rules and new Adventure decks that replace the Rise of the Dragonlords Adventure in the core set. These expansions not only tell new stories, but they give players new objectives and alternate win conditions.

Also included in the Essential Collection are the Beasts and Bandits and Traps and Terrors Challenge card expansions. These two decks will add plenty of variety to your encounters and can be mixed in to the Adventures of your choice.

Finally, the Essential Collection also comes with two Item and Ally card expansions, Weapons of Legend and Rituals and Runes. These decks add new cards to your Market deck, featuring new Item types and dozens of new weapons, allies, and artifacts!

-6 Previously released card expansions for Runebound
-2 Adventure Variants, 2 Challenge Card expansions, and 2 Market Card expansions

Name: Iron Tyrants
Description:
A Miniatures Game of Massive Robotic Mayhem

Iron Tyrants is a tabletop miniatures game of massive robotic combat. Each player will field a squad of tyrants, giant walking robots armed to the teeth with cannons, rockets, and lasers in an attempt to dominate the battlefield and crush his opponent under his metal heel. Sometimes, victory may mean simply being the last player with tyrants left standing, but a variety of scenarios are provided featuring a range of victory conditions so that every game is a completely different experience.

A full campaign is also included. The campaign will have players fighting for one of three factions over control of Gateworld Atropos and the future of the Allyrian Sector.  Rules are included for the variety of environs on the gateworld such that the gateworld's weather and conditons bring the battlefield to life.

The system is d10-based and features several areas of resource management leading players to balance risks versus rewards with nearly every decision on the table. The key behind this is the Overload mechanic in which a tyrant may be pushed well beyond its normal capabilities but at great risk to both the machine and the pilot. Players also have a limited supply of Tactics Dice which are used both in determining initiative and in activating special abilities provided by unique commanders. Gameplay is filled with difficult decisions in which every choice has a consequence.

The game was intended to be played on a tabletop filled with terrain but hexmaps may also be used without issue. All game measurements are made from a 1-inch round base so units may be represented by any appropriate miniature. In the very near future we will be releasing printable miniatures for each tyrant in the game.

It's a game about tough choices. It's a game about resource management. Most importantly, it's a game about giant robots blasting the hell out of each other across the torn landscape of the future.

Name: Coccinella's Racing
Description:
This is a racing game, freely inspired by the egiptian game of Senet.

The aim of the game is to bring all you pieces to the other side of the 30-spaces board; the piece move according to the dice throw: with 2,3,4,6 you can chose to move one piece of that amount. With 1 you move one piece of 1 space but can repeat the turn. With 5 you move ALL your pieces of 1 space. Spaces already occupied by own pieces can never be reached. Opponent pieces can instead be captured or jumped, unless they are in groups of 2 or 3 respectively.

From the box:
Who will be the first to bring his beetle to the finish line ?
A fun tactical contest....with a little bit of luck.

Name: Estratègia Territorial
Description:
Educational game where up to four players have to develop the territory of Catalonia (Spain) by establishing industries and equipments.

The players alternate taking turns moving their tokens around the board and building the different industries, buildings, and equipments.

Each player can choose among four different building strategies, each having its different Victory Points chart. At the end of the game, the player with more VPs wins.

Name: 7 Wonders: Leaders
Description: 7 Wonders: Leaders adds 42 new cards to the base game of 7 Wonders, comprising four new guilds, one new wonder card, and 36 (+1 blank) white "Leader" cards. At the start of the game, each player takes a hand of four leaders and may play one at the start of each of the three Ages. Unlike the standard cards, leaders cost money (not resources). The expansion comes with a new Wonder—the ancient city of Rome—and contains 6-gold tokens made of cardboard for more efficient money-management.

Name: Exquisite Rivalry
Description:
Now all of Count Hogarth's children have come of age it is time for them to prove themselves independently.   The Count has given each of them a small sum of his fortune to invest in building their own settlement.

The settlements must be filled with pleasure, be plentiful and ruled with an iron fist of power.  Without all of these elements it will not be exquisite and if it is anything less than exquisite you will be  banished, deep within the cellars of the Count's castle never to return again.

Only one child shall be the Count's future successor and you better make sure that it is you.

Exquisite rivalry is an auction game of 3 to 4 players based in a medieval setting.  Players compete to bid on different elements to improve their town.  The winner of each round getting first pick of the cards and the loser collecting the most gold in return.

The winner is the player who has managed to gain the highest majority in two out of the three elements required to impress Count Hogarth: Pleasure, Plenty and Power

Name: BattleTech: The Dragon Roars
Description:
From the back fo the book:

For seven long years, an uneasy truce has kept the Clan war machine from continuing its relentless march into the Inner Sphere - but young Clan Crusaders hungry for war now push for an end to the Truce of Tukayyid, and a renewal of the invasion. Building on the momentum of their victory over the Jade Falcons on Coventry, the Great House leaders create a Star League Constitution, resurrecting with a pen what they had failed to accomplish through the force of arms - a new Star League. With the might of all the Houses apparently united after hundreds of years of warfare, the members of this fragile union hatch a desperate plan to end the Clan threat once and for all - the complete destruction of a Clan.

The Dragon Roars is a BattleTech scenario pack that describes the brutal conflict between forces of the newly constituted Star League Defense Force - made up of a coalition army from every Great House - and the savage Smoke Jaguars. Detailed descriptions and maps follow each wave of this titanic struggle as the Inner Sphere sweeps into the Smoke Jaguar Occupation Zone. Twelve BattleTech scenarios and one BattleForce 2 scenario allows players to actively participate one of the largest conflicts in human history.

User comment:

This scenario pack is effectively the first in a two-volume series, the concluding volume being BattleTech: Twilight of the Clans. The rules specific to this campaign are also useful for self-generated campaigns as they provide detail on such things as installing Clan Tech in Inner Sphere 'Mechs as field upgrades.

Name: Angle Tangle
Description: An abstract game for two players. Each player gets square and triangle pieces in two colors, and must alternately place pieces on the board so that they touch a piece of the other color and do not touch pieces of the same color. The player with the smallest total area of remaining pieces wins.

Name: Monopoly: Manchester City FC Edition
Description:
Manchester City Football Club version of Monopoly.  In place of the traditional properties there are current and previous players, as well as football-themed playing pieces.

From the publisher:
Throughout Manchester City’s proud history, the club has built a deep, lasting kinship with their fans - following City can be a rollercoaster of dizzying highs and emotional lows, and this special edition of Monopoly commemorates those who have contributed to the club’s glorious heritage.

Name: The Family Affair Game
Description: A children's spin-and-move game in which players move pieces representing four characters from the show in a race to find the doll Mrs. Beasley, which is pictured on one of eight face-down tiles scattered on the gameboard.

Name: Monopoly: Blackpool & the Fylde Coast Edition
Description:
Version of Monopoly based around Blackpool and the Fylde Coast.  The traditional properties are replaced by locations including the Illuminations, the Winter Gardens and the Blackpool Tower.

From the publisher:
The historic town of Blackpool finds its home in this new edition of Monopoly! The classic board game moves away from Mayfair and Old Kent Road and onto the famous streets of Blackpool, with all its attractions.

Name: Make or Break
Description: Make or Break starts with 60 marbles in 4 colors randomly distributed on a grid. On a turn, a player rolls 4 special dice and swaps marbles of any opposing colors rolled with marbles of their color. The object is to create rows of at least 5 marbles of one's own color. Any rows created are scored immediately, and the game continues until someone reaches 1000 points.

Name: The Dot Game
Description: A version of the pencil-and-paper game Boxes, modified to allow (1) play by 2 to 4 players, and (2) a spinner that can dictate the number of segments the player must play or even their orientation (horizontal or vertical).  Once the fourth segment of a square is played, the player claims that square by placing a dot of his or her color in its center and then plays again; the winner is the player who has claimed the most squares by the end of the game.

Name: Myriad: The Word Game
Description:
In Myriad, each player has a board and a set of letter chips. The chips are placed on the boards to form words, with the score per letter being the number of letters in the word. Unusual features of the game include:


     After playing a word to their own board, a player may place their letters on other players' boards to form words. Each player with letters in a word scores for them.



     When a word is formed that contains shorter words (e.g., KIN which contains IN), the shorter words are scored as well.



     The center section of each board can be rotated to put the letters in different positions.


Several levels of alternative rules are provided for children.

The game was sold in two and four-player sets.

Name: Fun at the Zoo Game
Description: A variation on Candy Land, in which the players draw cards to move to the nearest square of that color as they advance towards the goal.  Differing from Along the way, they may draw a card inviting all players to a party being held at specially-marked squares on the path.

Name: Sálvame
Description:
This is a trivia game centered on the world of gossip and celebrities, with questions from the past and present that must be answered by the players in order to be the first to reach the GOAL square, and answer "The Challenge".
The game play consist in the roll of two dice, first one for moving through the board, and then another to choose from the four questions in the card. With a result of five in the second die the person questioning chooses one of the four, and with a six you move to the next space of the board, and your turn ends. 
If you fail the question, you normally have to move backwards several squares, and if you answer correctly you move forwards some squares. How many spaces you move will depend of the type of square you land on with the roll of the first die. (there are five different, and then the GOAL square)
The Challenge consists on answering correctly three of the four questions of one card. If you do it, victory is yours!

Name: Unforced Error Tennis
Description:
Simple statistical game on tennis, being an adaptation of the system pionereed in Olympic Tennis.
Each player is rated for Service and Return, plus his ability to win Tie Break and be more decisive than his/her opponent in the hotter phases of each match. 
As almost all statistical sport game, is better suited for solitaire gaming and you may complete a match in a matter of minutes, as the score is calculated game after game.

Name: Texas Tech-opoly
Description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

Located in Lubbock, Texas Tech University® is a major comprehensive research institution rich in tradition, athletics, and heart. Raiderland is a place where students explore their interests, discover their passions and realize their potential. Ask students or alumni, there’s nothing quite like the Red Raider spirit!


Looking for a fun way to experience
TEXAS TECH UNIVERSITY®? Here it is!
All the fun... none of the studying!

Choose your token and advance to GO RED RAIDERS! Collect credit hours and
trade them in for diplomas. You may soon be marching in the Goin’ Band of Raiderland... or bumming quarters to do your laundry!

Name: Wichita-opoly
Description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

A board game about the GREAT city of Wichita!
We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some airplanes, Native American heritage, a beautiful western landscape, and some BIG FUN...
and voilà behold; WICHITA-OPOLY!
Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play!
Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Name: Washington-opoly
Description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some cherry blossoms, great parks, a few festivals, the arts, some BIG FUN... and voilà behold; Washington-OPOLY!

Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play!
Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Name: Topeka-opoly
Description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

A board game about the GREAT city of Topeka!
We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some hot air balloons, sunflowers, a great big motorsports facility, and some BIG FUN... and voilà behold; Topeka-OPOLY!

Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play!
Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Name: Houston-opoly
Description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

It’s impossible to include everything, but we jammed all the HOUSTON we could into this box. It’s filled with sports, art, breathtaking parks, space technology, and a bayou or two! Looking for a fun way to experience Space City? Here it is!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play!

Buy your favorite HOUSTON properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! So choose your token and advance to Go HOUSTON! You may soon be running for mayor... or lost in outer space!

Name: Cleveland-opoly
Description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

It’s impossible to include everything, but we jammed all the
Cleveland we could into this box. It’s filled with sports, music, dog bones, buzzards - a little something for every Clevelander!
Looking for a fun way to experience C-Town? Here it is!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play!

Buy your favorite Cleveland properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! So choose your token and advance to Go Cleveland! You may soon be running for mayor... or migrating with the buzzards!

Name: Charleston-opoly
Description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Charleston we could into this box.  From Sweetgrass Baskets to the Charleston Harbor and all the charm in between, here’s a fun way to experience Charleston, South Carolina!

HERE’S A QUICK IDEA OF HOW TO PLAY...

Buy your favorite Charleston Properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City.  Sound easy?  Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

So choose your token and advance to Go Charleston!  You may soon be the mayor of Charleston... Or you may end up in the City Jail!

Name: Fort Worth-opoly
Description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

It’s impossible to include everything, but we jammed all the  FORT WORTH we could into this box. It’s filled with old west flare, stunning art, Texas hospitality, Honky-Tonk, and a Cattle Drive or two!  Looking for a fun way to experience Cowtown? Here it is!
Here’s a quick idea of how to play!

Buy your favorite FORT WORTH properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! So choose your token and advance to Go FORT WORTH! You may soon be running for mayor... or lost in
The Cowtown Cattlepen Maze!

Name: Portland-opoly
Description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

How do you make a game about a place like this?

While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Portland we could into this box.  From a park too small for one person to the magnificent Mt. Hood backdrop and all the eclectic wonder in between, this is beautiful Portland, Oregon!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play...

Buy your favorite PORTLAND properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

So choose our token and advance to taxi! You may soon be
the mayor of Portland... or you may be summiting Mt. Hood!

Name: Monopoly: Isle of Wight Edition
Description: Version of the board game Monopoly, with the traditional properties replaced with locations from the Isle of Wight including The Needles, the Isle of Wight Festival and Osbourne House which was Queen Victoria's residence on the island.

Name: Monopoly: Highlands & Islands Edition
Description: Version of Monopoly using locations such as Ben Nevis and Loch Ness from the Highlands and Islands of Scotland in place of the traditional properties.

Name: Fighter-Tac
Description:
Carrier based starfighter combat.

Fighter-Tac is a deeply strategic card game for two players. Each player is in command of a massive warship called a Battle-Carrier, and each uses a customized deck of cards called the Flight-Deck. The goal of the game is to use your Fighters and other cards in your Flight-Deck to destroy your opponent's Battle-Carrier, before he or she destroys yours.

Gameplay consists of drawing cards from your Flight-Deck on your turn, then spending Resource Cards (Fuel, Energy and Ammo) to launch Fighters and shoot their weapons in an attemp to destroy the opponents Battle-Carrier. The Flight-Deck also contains other cards to aid in the fight, such as Skill Patches for your pilots, Refits for your Fighters, Modules that upgrade your Carrier, and even Support ships to increase your firepower or defense. Resources must spent to play these other cards as well.

There are various kinds of Fighters at your disposal: Interceptors, Assault Fighters and Bombers are just a few. Each has their own strengths and weaknesses. Knowing when to attack with which Fighter is vital to winning the game.

Using your Resources, dice rolls, and other cards in your deck, your goal is to get your Fighters across the Combat Zone to the opponent's Battle-Carrier so they can make attack runs in an attempt to destroy it. Your opponent will send out Fighters to try to intercept and destroy yours as well. Any of your Fighters that make it through will be able to attempt an attack run on the enemy Battle-Carrier. Each Battle-Carrier has a limited amount of Armor Points. Once the enemy Battle-Carrier's Armor Points are depleted, it is destroyed and you win!

A combination of deck construction, Fighter tactics, and using your Resource Cards wisely is the key to victory. Resources can give a Fighter or a Pilot strengths and abilities that can win the day over the enemy. They can also be used to make your Battle-Carrier more efficient and deadly as well, thus increasing its chances for survival, and increasing your chances to win the game.

Name: Monopoly: 2010 Fifa World Cup South Africa Edition
Description: Version of Monopoly themed on the 2010 Fifa World Cup, including competing nations in place of the traditional coloured property sets, stadia in place of the stations and half time/full time cards instead of the chance/community chest cards.

Name: Die Insel der Steinernen Wächter Expansion Pack
Description:
The expansion pack was printed as price support for tournaments and as give away for the game fair Essen 2010.

It contains four new races and four new runes to play with the base game.

Name: BattleTech BattlePack: Fourth Succession War
Description:
From the back of the book:

In the year 3028, the leaders of the Great Houses of the Inner Sphere gathered on the planet Terra as First Prince Hanse Davion of the Federated Suns and Heir-designate Melissa Steiner of the Lyran Commonwealth were joined in marriage. Historians prophesied that t heir union -- and the union of their two Houses -- would usher in an age of peace and prosperity not seen since the fall of the Star League. But they were wrong -- because even as the marriage ceremony took place, thousands of BattleMechs stood poised to launch one of the largest military campaigns in centuries!

The BattlePack is a new and innovative game supplement that requires only the contents of the BattleTech 4th Edition boxed set to play, making it ideal for the beginning player while offering seasoned players the opportunity to experience the BattleTech universe as it began. BattlePack: Fourth Succession War is based on events in Michael Stackpole's classic Warrior Trilogy novel series. From the opening salvos until the final shots ring out, this supplement takes you step-by-step through the titanic struggle known as the Fourth Succession War.

This expansion features:

Ten new, ready-to-play scenarios.
The new, never-before-seen Woodland BattleTech map.
Eight additional BattleMech record sheets, four of which are new variants:BJ-3 Blackjack, HOP-4B Hoplite, CTF-2X Cataphract and CGR-1A5 Charger.
20 full-color stand-up playing pieces.

User comment:

This BattlePack is out of print, and it's increasingly difficult to find a complete pack that includes the playing pieces and map. Although it's described by FASA as their first BattlePack, it was also the last.

The main sourcebook itself is still useable without the pieces although just over half of the scenarios in the pack use the Woodlands Map when setting up the map.  It's unclear if the map will be re-released at any point by the current licence holder, although other heavily wooded maps with hills such as the two Rolling Hills maps re-released in the Classic BattleTech Map Compilation 1 are reasonable substitutes. The four new 'Mech variants described as new with this expansion have since been re-released in various other expansions.

Name: BattleTech Field Manual: Crusader Clans
Description:
From the back of the book:

Nearly three hundred years ago, the Star League was torn apart when the lies and deceits of the petty House Lords launched the Inner Sphere into endless war. The Great Father Aleksandr Kerensky led our forefathers, the remnants of the righteous Star League army, away from that chaotic despotism. In turn, his son Nicholas  forged us into the Clans: a society dedicated to becoming the greatest fighting force in all of history. We grew stronger with each generation, awaiting the day when we would return to the Inner Sphere to save it from itself.

Now is the time of the Return. Some among the Clans oppose the Crusaders' campaign of conquest, but we know that true enlightenment can only come to the misguided rabble of the Successor States through total subjugation. We will crush their honorless armies with our OmniMechs and plant the flag of the Clans on sacred Terra. Only then will the true Star League have returned to the Inner Sphere.

User comment:

The companion volume to the Field Manual: Warden Clans, this volume follows up on earlier books dedicated to the Clans and gives more detail on the seven Clans identified as being Crusader clans at the time of printing.  More detail is given on the five Clans that hadn't been covered in earlier sourcebook at the time, and with those Clans comes detail on more new equipment, 'Mechs and Battle Armour not seen before in the Inner Sphere.

This sourcebook is out of print, and hasn't been released in electronic format by the current license holder.

Name: BattleTech Field Manual:   Warden Clans
Description:
From the publisher's website:

Nearly three hundred years ago, the Star League was torn apart when the ambitious House Lords launched the Inner Sphere into endless war. The Great Father Aleksandr Kerensky led our forefathers, the remnants of the noble Star League army, away from that empty conflict. In turn, his son Nicholas forged us into the Clans: a society founded on unity, strength and skill. With each generation we evolved, awaiting the day when we would return to the Inner Sphere to save it from itself.

Now is the time of the Return. Some among the Clans insist that conquest of the Inner Sphere is the only Way, but we know that this path will only lead us into the chaos of the past. Our true mission is far more noble: we must act as the Wardens of the Inner Sphere until the time is right and humanity is truly reunited. Only then will the true Star League have returned to the Inner Sphere.

-- Ulric Kerensky, ilKhan of the Clans

The second of two volumes on the Clans, Field Manual: Warden Clans describes the Defenders of Kerensky's Vision: Clans Cloud Cobra, Coyote, Diamond Shark, Ghost Bear, Goliath Scorpion, Snow Raven and Steel Viper. This book describes the tactics, military doctrines and battle histories of each Clan, plus special rules that reflect the unique capabilities of each Galaxy, new weapons, equipment, exclusive Warden BattleMechs and more.

User comment:

Following up on earlier sourcebooks devoted to the Clans, this gives detail on all of those Clans identified as Warden Clans at the time of printing. Some of the Clans receive more attention than others, depending on how much detail was already in print via previous books. Along with the background detail on the Clans, the expansion also details new Battle Armour variants, a new OmniMech, a new weapon system and new Warships are all introduced in this expansion, although these items have largely been reprinted in later sourcebooks.

This book is a companion volume to the BattleTech Field Manual: Crusader Clans, and is currently out of print. The current license holder hasn't published this book as an electronic download as yet.

Name: BattleTech: Master Rules
Description:
From the back of the book:

THE FUTURE OF WARFARE IS HERE!

Welcome to the 31st century, a time of endless wars that rage across the known universe. These epic conflicts are won and lost by BattleMechs, 30-foot-tall, humanoid titans of metal bristling with high-intensity lasers, rapid-fire autocannon and dozens of other lethal weapons; enough firepower to level entire city blocks. Your elite force of MechWarriors drive these juggernauts into battle, blasting at your opponent's 'Mechs in a deadly game of kill or be killed. Will they become instant legends, or forgotten casualties? Only your skill and luck will determine their fate.

Drawing on years of experience, this book combines the best of the BattleTech board game into a unified whole. BattleTech Master Rules is entirely restructured and streamlined; it is the same game, but like you've never seen it before. This book includes the complete game rules, a quick-and-easy scenario creation system, the Battle Value point system for evaluating 'Mechs and balancing forces, and revised and expanded miniatures rules.

User comment:

This was the default, complete ruleset for BattleTech at the time of printing, superceding the earlier BattleTech Compendium: Rules of Warfare.  Again, no rules were included for AeroTech or BattleSpace units; this ruleset was dedicated to ground-based combat.

These rules were revised and re-issued several times.  The original FASA edition was published in 1998, and was then substantially updated and re-issued as the FASA Revised edition in 2001, one of the last BattleTech sourcebooks produced by FASA.

In 2002, the BattleTech license was taken over by FanPro, and in 2003 they revised the Master Rules and reossued them as the Classic BattleTech Master Rules, Revised in a softback format, followed by a hardback edition in 2004.

The BattleTech: Master Rules were finally superceded when Fanpro released the first edition of Classic BattleTech: Total Warfare in 2006.

Name: BattleTech: Twilight Of The Clans
Description:
From the back of the book:

THE STAR LEAGUE STRIKES BACK!

The brave warriors of Task Force Serpent secretly made the thousand-light-year journey to the Smoke Jaguar home world of Huntress to eliminate the last of the Clan's holdings. What they find there will test the limits of their skills, their endurance and their loyalty.

Twilight of the Clans is a BattleTech scenario pack that picks up where the Dragon Roars left off, as the campign to end the Clan invasion reaches its stunning climax! Players can take the part of the Star League or the defending Clans in a series of ten BattleTech scenarios, and even accept the challenge of commanding the entire assault on Huntress in a detailed BattleForce 2 campaign.

User comment:

This BattleTech scenario pack forms the second volume in the series charting the end of the war between the Clans and the Inner Sphere, and follows on from the earlier BattleTech scenario "The Dragon Roars." While this scenario pack doesn't add any new rules or equipment, it does incorporate a wide range of units including ProtoMechs and OmniFighters, and includes detail on BattleForce 2 campaigns, a relative rarity in BattleTech scenarios.

Although this scenario pack is now out of print, it's available as an electronic download from the current license holder.

Name: Monopoly: Fulham FC Edition
Description:
Version of Monopoly which replaces the traditional properties with players from Fulham FC past and present.

From the publisher's website:
A must for all Fulham fans, this new edition of Monopoly features current stars alongside the legends of the past, and is your chance to find out just who is the hottest property at the club!

Put together your own dream team by buying and selling players as you try to bankrupt your opponents.

Now's your chance to snap up the likes of Andy Johnson, Johnny Haynes, Alan Mullery, George Cohen and even Mohamed Al Fayed himself, as well as the famous stands of Craven Cottage as you race round the board and to victory!

Name: Abducted by Aliens
Description:
Escape from an alien spaceship by overcoming obstacles and helping the visitors to learn more about the planet Earth.

Movement on the map can only be done between adjacent spaces. Every space you land on has a play card that reveals quests, grant items, or pose challenges, such as finding a key, competing with another player, drawing a picture, acting out a pantomime or really anything. The outcome of any performance or challenge is decided by one of the othere players or by voting with special cards. Try to pass it as many times as you wish or just find your way around.

The goal of the game is to be first to the finish square after opening a certain number of play cards.

The game is very engaging and requires some logic and strategic skills.

Name: The IN Game
Description: The IN Game or Initials Game is a game in which you make your way around a board and as you go, you are challenged to figure out famous athletes, politicians, entertainers, and other influential historical figures. You are given their initials, one clue, and 30 seconds.  For example: GW and "The father of our country."  The answer is George Washington. WS and 'He bought Alaska." The answer is William Seward.  Land on a BETS space, and opponents can place bets (double or nothing) on whether or not you can answer a clue in a tough category.  The IN Game includes 1,200 different clues. This game can be played with 2-6 individual players or in teams.

Name: Homage & Fealty
Description:
Homage & Fealty is a card game for 2-6 players where you bid resources (your treasury) to woo population into your kingdom in order to enrich it. The more people you have, the more attractive it'll become and the more resources you'll have in order to woo more population.

You'll need the custom deck, 10 cubes in 6 different colors, poker chips that can handle at least 3 different denominations, and about 30-45 minutes of time.

Each card represents a person such as a farmer, potter, candlestick maker, etc. that have a certain cost to get them to move to your kingdom and declare their fealty to your crown. Each provides victory points which allows you to win the game. The player with the highest VP total wins.

Originally entered in Quick Print and Play Design Challenge - General Discussion Thread

Name: Balkan Warfare: 10 Scenarios Compatible with the ASL System
Description:
Scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader.  Scenarios in this pack include:

FE 50 Hungarian Action: Hungarian paratroopers drop into action! Yes, I said Hungarian Paratroopers!! This battle is the one fight where the Hungarian paratroopers actually did a combat drop. Ok this is not 100% historically accurate, the landing was unopposed and the Hungarians marched into battle but still somewhat captures the action of a bridge capture. Uses boards 23 and 49 and is medium sized.

FE 51 Wolf Pack in the Hills: Many of you have been clamoring for a good ambush scenario. Ok maybe one of you, but here is a cool situation. An Italian convoy moves across the board 50 hill and runs into a Partisan ambush. Partisans basically have to annihilate the convoy, while the Italians basically have to survive.

FE 52 With Friends Like These: Set on boards 32 and 50 this scenario features the Italians (actually Albanians serving for Italy) fighting the Bulgarians. A nice tourney sized scenario the Italians have to capture some buildings from the defending Bulgarians.

FE 53 Operation Braun: This is the meatiest of the bunch with a large Partisan force defending against Croatian troops backed up by some armor. Set on boards 41 and 50, the Croatians have to capture some buildings. Tough to accomplish against stone buildings.

FE 54 Dubrovnik 2: This is an interesting one set on board 48. Attacking Croatian troops have to kick out a small Partisan force from the village. Then they have defend against a counterattacking force. The victory conditions are tied around holding buildings, with fortified buildings (which can be made during play) counting for more VP. A smaller sized scenario that should allow for some good replay.

FE 55 Friends No More: Here is cool scenario set on boards 4, 8 and FE1 (free for download from my website, for use with VASL). Germans and Rumanians try to control a bridge with the Germans having to get some VP over the bridge. Again, another smaller tourney sized scenario.

FE 56 Covering the Retreat: This is a medium sized scenario set on boards w and 18. Defending Germans get some armor including French tanks and have to defend against a tidal wave, well a small wave of Russian combined arms. Germans try to hold onto a building or 3.

FE 57 War Without End: Defending Germans with some Italian tanks and assault guns defend the board 12 village from very powerful British armored troops crossing the board 50 hill mass. The Germans who are very brittle try to keep a hold of a building or two while the Brits race against time.

FE 58 The End is in Sight: A medium sized scenario featuring Croatian infantry and armor trying to break through a Partisan blocking force. Set on boards 10 and 44. This is another one of those scenarios featuring vehicles from Armies of Oblivion; another example of the vast amount of scenarios that can now be played with ASL.

FE 59 But We’re Not Quite There!: Once again a tired Croatian armor and infantry force, this time smaller due to previous battles tries to blast through a Partisan blocking force. This is another tourney-sized scenario set on board 45.

Name: Duelers
Description:
Duelers is an action figure based collectible game where players amass exciting armies to battle their friends. Duelers miniatures stand two to three inches tall and represent a vast variety of genres and archetypes. Duelers are meant to be easy to pickup and play. Players can choose to play with two duelers or twenty; there is no minimum or maximum army counnt.  Like other miniatures games systems, Duelers is based on 6-sided dice to randomize combat. However, in addition to dice, Duelers utilizes "combat cards" to add an extra level of strategy to the game. Attack Cards can give you an extra edge in battle, and Defense Cards will cause your opponent's carefully laid plans of men (and mice) to go awry.

In addition to total enemy annihilation, players are vying for special game objectives in the form of Treasure Chests. Successfully defending your own chests is good, but capturing your opponent's chests is what separates the winners and the losers.  Gameplay proceeds as players alternate turns until one of three things happens. Either all of the Treasure Chests are captured, or all of a player’s Duelers are slain, or there’s an earthquake that shakes the pieces onto the floor.

Name: Speed Dating
Description:
In Speed Dating everybody gets a new personality consisting of a name, age, job and five hobbies out of six categories (travelling, culture, sports, leisure time, esoterism and nerd stuff). You have 45 seconds to interview each of the other players.

Remember their traits, find the one who fits best, and live happily ever after.

Name: 1879: A sangre y fuego en las costas de los Andes
Description:
1879: A sangre y fuego is a wargame covering the main campaigns of the War of the Pacific: the campaigns of Antofagasta, Tarapá and Tacna, as well as the maritime operations involved. One player leads the Chilean army, while the other leads the Peruvian and Bolivian troops. The map represents the zone of the conflict, between Arequipa and the desert of Atacama.

It is a typical wargame with the system "I go - you go", in which victory is obtained by means of control of geographical objectives. The rules take into account supply and lines of communication.

Name: Mi Gato se Incendia!
Description:
Mi Gato se Incendia! (My Cat is on Fire!)  A board game of escaped housecats and strange situations.In Mi Gato se Incendia! 2-6 players take the part of a family chasing after their escaped house cat.Mi Gato has slipped its bonds and is running free through the neighborhood. But with freedom, comes a price.

Fire.

Rogue Russian satellites, BBQ grills, street punks - and much more can cause Mi Gato to burst into a fiery ball of spite. Mi Gato has 9 lives and it's up to the players to capture it and return it safely home, or no one wins!

Use two decks of cards - one to move Mi Gato, the other to call in the vet, put a smoldering cat out, capture Mi Gato, and foil each others plans!

Mi Gato se Incendia is an electronic publication, available as PDFs and comes with everything you'll need to play this game.  The game board can be printed out on a single piece of 8.5" x 11" paper.  All cards will fit on standard Avery Business Card templates, or can be printed on plain paper.

Name: House2House
Description:
The goal of this game is to become familiar with selected scriptures found in Bible Topics for Discussion.

In his turn Publisher (player) should choose one of his Scriptural Questions cards while keeping it hidden from every player in the game and ask the next player in clockwise order the scriptural question.
The responding Publisher can answer the question directly or may request for a Hint.

Publisher may be awarded the score at the top right corner of the Scriptural Questions card, or the score at the bottom left corner of the Scriptural Questions card if a fair knowledge of the scripture is established.
Whenever a responding Publisher fails to get the answer correctly (with/without the hint) within the period of the sand timer, the asking Publisher should read out the correct answer to the rest of the Publishers in the game and then move his Pawn according to the number appearing on the bottom left corner of the Scriptural Questions card in the direction of the arrow on the board.
Winner is the players with the most points.

Name: Dice Age Elementary Edition
Description:
This Game is the french Bonide dice game adapted into a card game. You play with decks of cards. Each deck represents a die, and each card within the deck represents a side of the die. Thus a six sided die is represented by a six cards deck with the same back.
At the beginning of the game, decks and tokens are distributed. Your goal is to get rid of all your tokens.
It's a risk-taking game.

When you choose a deck on your turn, you get rid of tokens, depending on the color of the deck. You can then draw a number or an effect on the game. If you draw a number, it has to be lower than the last number played, or you take all of the pot.

Name: Alpha Word Game System
Description:
The Alpha Word Game System is a comprehensive word game system made up of three components; a deck of Alpha Playing Cards, a set of Alpha Tiles and a double set of Alpha Dice. All three components are by themselves a game system, so having any one component allows you to play several different  games, having all three allows you to play even more games.

The Alpha Word Game System is based on the original deck of Alpha Playing Cards which was released in 1997. There has been a two minor changes made to the Alpha Playing Cards in creating the Alpha Word Game System. The first is the addition of the marked vowels on the semi-wild vowels cards and the second is the addition of the board grid on the backs of the Alpha Playing Cards allowing the cards to be made into game boards for the tiles and dice.

The Alpha Word Game System and its components are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 United States License; so anyone can make their own components for the Alpha Word Game System. There are free PDF files that you can use to make your own set. If you are feeling really creative, you can design your own graphics too. You can make as many copies as you like, and if you are in a entrepreneurial mood, you can sell them. If you have question about the  Creative Commons License or would like more information please refer go to creativecommons.org. If you still have questions on how it relates to Alpha  write to one of the designers.

Name: BattleTech: Shattered Sphere
Description:
From the back of the book:

In early 3061, Prince Victor Steiner-Davion returned from the Clan homeworlds triumphant—but to an Inner Sphere that was radically different. The entire Ghost Bear population had relocated to the Inner Sphere; the St. Ives Compact was under siege; Katrina Steiner-Davion was sitting on the throne of New Avalon. Even with the overwhelming threat of the Clan invasion defeated, the Inner Sphere is still poised precariously between peace and war. Who will light the spark that will set BattleMechs marching and worlds aflame once more?

Drawing on information from five scenario packs, seven sourcebooks and more than a dozen novels, Shattered Sphere represents the ultimate guide to the people and places of BattleTech, as seen through the eyes of the characters who live there. Offering a brief, comprehensive history of the universe and an in-depth look at events from the Truce of Tukayyid through early 3062, this update is a must for any BattleTech fan. Shattered Sphere also includes detailed maps showing the current state of the Inner Sphere and the Clans.

User comment:

Although Shattered Sphere was released at something of an odd time as it fell halfway through the release schedule of the BattleTech Field Manual series. It provides a general update on the major changes and events affecting the various Houses, Clans and major Periphery powers from the 3050s through to around 3061; the detailed state and border maps are very useful for BattleTech and BattleForce 2 campaigns, and this sourcebook is one of the few to touch on two of the up and coming Periphery powers, the Marian Hegemony and the Circinus Federation.

Name: BattleTech Field Manual: ComStar
Description:
From the back of the book:

To maintain their monopoly on the flow of information and technology across the vast reaches of space, the powerful organization known as ComStar waged a hidden war of assassination, sabotage and terrorism for more than two hundred years. Now, the Star League has been resurrected and ComStar will play a pivotal role in its continued survival... or its ultimate downfall.

BattleTech Field Manual: ComStar describes the military doctrine, traditions, tactics and battle histories of ComStar's military division, the Com Guards, and the Word of Blake splinter group. This book also provides complete information on the Free Rasalhague Republic and units of the new Star League, including the Eridani Light Horse and Clan Nova Cat, plus new equipment and 'Mechs unique to ComStar.

User comment:

In common with the rest of the BattleTech Field Manual series, this sourcebook provides an military-focussed overview of the entity on the cover - ComStar, in this case - as well as some new rules, equipment and 'Mechs associated with that fasion.

What makes the ComStar Field Manual unusual in comparison to the House and Clan Field Manuals is that it includes a lot of details on both the second Star League, and a number of entities associated with it, in addition to the Word of Blake schismatics. This allowed FASA to fold in the general updates for the Free Rasalhague Republic along with a couple of famous units associated with the old and new Star League as well as Clan Novacat, which had joined the new Star League. That makes this Field Manual more wide-ranging than the others that had published at the time.

This sourcebook is out of print, and unlike the older BattleTech: ComStar sourcebook, it hasn't been released in an electronic form by the current license holder.

Name: BattleTech Field Manual: Capellan Confederation
Description:
From the back of the book:

Ravaged during the Succession Wars and poorly governed by paranoid Chancellors, the Capellan Confederation has languished at the mercy of its more powerful neighbours for centuries. However, the time of Xin Sheng has arrived. A new birth. The devious and brilliant Sun-Tzu Liao leads his people into a glorious era of national pride and prosperity. Through subterfuge and warfare, he is driven to reclaim everything the Confederation has lost.

BattleTech Field Manual: Capellan Confederation provides an in-depth look at the rising power of House Liao, including profiles on every Confederation regiment and the regiments of the newly conquered St. Ives Compact. Special rules reflecting the unique abilities of each regiment are included, along with new equipment and 'Mechs exclusive to the Capellan Confederation.

User comment:

This sequel to the earlier House Liao (The Capellan Confederation) follows the same format as the other BattleTech Field Manuals in that it focuses largely on the military structure of the Capellan Confederation before introducing a scattering of new equipment, 'Mechs, vehicles, a Warship and some Battle Armour.

While this sourcebook is out of print, it has been released in an electronic format by the new license holder, Catalyst Game Labs, making it much easier to get hold of than some of the other Field Manuals.

Name: Junior Dessinez c'est gagné
Description: User review: One player tries draws the object designated on the card while the drawer's teammates try to guess what the object is. There are three catagories: personne (person), lieu (place), and chose (thing). This children's game is very similar to Pictionary.

Name: Loot!
Description:
User review: Players start at Jail (where they have been held for questioning) with five one-thousand dollar bills and three INFO cards. In turn, they roll both dice and move around the gameboard, following instructions from the space on which they land and negotiating with other players whenever it is to one's advantage. The game ends when the bank is depleted and whoever has the most money wins.

The game is subtitled "The genteel game of burglary."

Name: HITOYA
Description:
Hitoya is a two player abstract card game where players take turns claiming and capturing tiles on a four by four grid. Each player gets a hand of character cards which represent key players in the "Amelio Tale." These cards provide tiles and special power tokens for placement on the board.

Tiles denote a number or symbol on each side. When a tile is first placed on the grid it automatically attacks all of its neighbors (if the number/symbol is greater on the attacking tile, the attack is successful). Some tiles are considered "scoring" and the majority of the game revolves around capturing and recapturing them.

There are only 15 spaces on the grid to lay tiles so games are typically fairly short (10-15 minutes). The first edition of the game includes four power types (Life, Death, Chaos, and Rotate) and twenty unique characters.

Name: Space Ork Maintenance Crews!
Description:
For every slavering ork wielding a kill-a-zap gun with a bowie knife duct taped underneath, there's another trying to remember which is the crescent wrench and which is the end wrench. No ork chieftain wants to be in charge of this lot, so the bosses strive against each other to assign more competent crews to more important jobs in the hopes of getting transferred back to the combat arm.

In this tactical card game players try to win points by playing better orks to the higher value assignments, while watching out for a couple kinds of back-stabbing. This game lies between the dice game Catego and the card game Schotten-Totten, but with space orks!.

(From the introduction.)

Name: Triple Tier
Description:
A game very similar to Sorry.  Players have 5 pieces of three types that they move from their start spaces on tier one, up to their home spaces on tier 3.  Two pieces can only move around the board to the left, two can only move around to the right and one can move in either direction.  Landing on certain spaces by exact count lets you move up to the next tier.

The game is played by rolling a single die and then picking which of your pieces to move in the direction they are allowed to go.

Name: Strike Dice
Description:
Basic Gameplay
Strike Dice is a game for 2-4 players. Each player owns 8 Pyramid Dice and must place on the board as many as possible. The purpose of the game is to collect the most Triangle Cards which they carry variable effects and help you during the game. To win a card you must place the most dice on the board at the end of every Triangulation.

The game board is separated into a number of shapes. The large kit shapes in Red and Blue are called Tribases. Each of you, can place max 1 die on a Tribase. The Red bases are strategically important as they help to spread your dice on the rest dark bases. The small red triangles, at the base of each Tribase is an Exit Point. There are 4 in total and through these, your dice can enter and move on the board.

Strike Dice is a clever, short in time  and easy to learn game carrying a new innovative way to use Pyramid Dice. We call them Pawndice because they have 2 roles in the game. You can use them as Pawns and as Dice too!

Name: Wagon Trader
Description:
Wagon Trader is a meeple-placement, pick up and deliver trading game set in the old west in Dodge City, Kansas. Players deliver goods to the territories of Oklahoma, Nebraska, Missouri, Texas, Montana and Oregon.

Players have four meeples each to place, in turn order, round and round on various buildings in the town. Instead of placing a meeple on his turn, a player may take certain free actions that require payment of money, goods or food instead of a meeple. These free actions are resolved immediately. Each meeple is then resolved in order, moving from top to bottom of the board, one player at a time.

Name: BattleTech Field Manual: Federated Suns
Description:
From the back of the book:

Dominant for centuries, House Davion has led the Federated Suns to greatness through brilliant and innovative leadership. The Federated Suns have carved a prominent swath through history: the Davions formed a military that rewrote modern warfare; created the New Avalon Institute of Science, giving the Inner Sphere its first technological renaissance in three centuries; and united the military might of the Federated Suns with the economic power of House Steiner, creating the vast star empire known as the Federated Commonwealth. But with such power comes corruption -- and civil war is looming on the horizon.

BattleTech Field Manual: Federated Suns provides profiles on every Federated Suns regiment, including their loyalties, and provides special rules, new equipment and 'Mechs unique to this powerful House.

User comment:

This sequel to the earlier House Davion (The Federated Suns) takes the same format as the other BattleTech Field Manuals in that it focuses largely on the military structure of the Federated Suns before introducing a scattering of new equipment, 'Mech variants, an OmniMech, a Warship and some Battle Armour. In this case, the new technology consists of the Rotary Autocannon, new Autocannon ammunition (although some is reprinted from earlier sourcebooks) and Inner Sphere Targetting Computers.

While this sourcebook is out of print, it has been released in an electronic format by the new license holder, Catalyst Game Labs, making it much easier to get hold of than some of the other Field Manuals.

Name: BattleTech Field Manual: Lyran Alliance
Description:
From the back of the book:

House Steiner has always been the unchallenged economic power of the Inner Sphere. Transformed from merchant-princes to a military juggernaut by years of war, the alliance with House Davion gave them the most powerful 'Mechs money can buy and a streamlined chain of command. Now, the Steiner-Davion alliance has fractured from within, threatening to engulf both nations in civil war.

BattleTech Field Manual: Lyran Alliance reveals the strengths and weaknesses of the new Alliance forces. This manual describes each Lyran regiment and its loyalties, profiles and special rules, plus cutting-edge equipment and the latest 'Mechs from the famed Steiner factories.

User comment

This sequel to the earlier House Steiner (The Lyran Commonwealth) is the penultimate volume in the FIeld Manuals series for BattleTech to be published by FASA. It follows much the same format as the other Field Manuals in that it focuses largely on the military structure of the Capellan Confederation before introducing a scattering of new equipment and units. Suiting the original Steiner theme in the fluff, all of the new discoveries are biased towards the heavy end of the spectrum, and consist of such things as Heavy Gauss Rifles, a new Assault 'Mech, and the largest Warship ever constructed in the Inner Sphere.

This sourcebook is out of print, and hasn't been released in an electronic format by the new license holder, That makes this one of the harder to find Field Manuals.

Name: En Pointe Toujours!: Blindés français au combat 1987-2008
Description:
Blindés français au combat 1987-2008 (French Armour in combat 1987-2008) is an expansion, only available in French, for En Pointe Toujours V: Afrique contemporaine, fifth module of the En Pointe Toujours! series. 
En Pointe Toujours V: Afrique contemporaine was published with Vae Victis 80.

This DTP expansion includes one countersheet, three sheets of terrains, historical notes, twelve scenarios and one campaign.
Families: Series: En Pointe Toujours! system (Vae Victis)

Name: We Must Tell the Emperor: Expansion Kit
Description:
The We Must Tell the Emperor Expansion Kit includes some interesting options that can enrich your gameplay and make the game's narrative even more compelling. Along with several scenarios, there's also 16 additional Event cards and new counter pieces, there's more flavor and challenges to this game.

With an increased focus on China, the addition of the Soviets, the Allied invasion plans of Japan, plus the 4 card End War (“Atomic”) mini-deck, players can now bring the war to its full (and brutal) conclusion if they so choose.

Note, this Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of We Must Tell the Emperor to use this expansion kit.

Game Components:

• 1 Rules sheet
• 1 Scenario sheet
• 16 new Event cards
• 6 3/4" square game pieces


Japanes edition combines We Must Tell the Emperor and We Must Tell the Emperor expansion kit.

Name: Cameroon
Description: This is a promotional game from Northwest Orient Airlines that his very much like Yahtzee.  The player has three attempts to roll ten dice.  On each attempt they may choose to keep as many dice as they like and only re-roll the rest.  Scoring is done by checking to see where your best poker hand lies.  A player loses a certain amount of points depending on which poker hands they were not able to get after five rounds.  The person with the score closest to zero wins.

Name: Fanatic Pack #2
Description:
From the publisher's web site:
 This scenario pack contains 12 well-tested, balanced, fun and different scenarios.
 FE 13 Defeat at Seroczyn, September 1939: The desperate Poles are scraping the bottom of the barrel throwing everything they can at the Germans to stem the tide. In this action the Poles attempt a combined arms assault across the board 40 river into the Board 12 village against German light tanks, armored cars and infantry.

FE 14 Stab in the Back, September 1939: Poland is collapsing. The Poles are racing for the Rumanian border to salvage what they can. This action, set on boards 50, 48 and 44 is a race for the board edge as a fleeing Polish column including tanks, tankettes, cavalry and infantry try to fight their way past a blocking force of Russian tanks with reinforcing infantry.

FE 15 Contested Landing, May 1940: The German invasion of the west is on. The elite German paratroopers attack using a novel approach to war, the vertical envelopment. But not all goes well at the Waalhaven Airfield. This close-run action features both gliders and paratroopers trying to capture the board 14 airfield against Belgian Infantry and AA Guns. Also uses board 13.

FE 16 Where the Bullet Meets the Bone, November 1941: The former Yugoslavia was a dangerous place for the Axis. Partisans were everywhere. In this action set in November 1941, Tito's Partisans, using captured tankettes try to kick the Italian Garrison out of the board 48 village.

FE 17 Philippine Scouts at Mabatang, January 1942: The battle of Bataan would prove two things; that the Japanese soldier was much better than the propaganda said and the Philippine Scouts were a tough breed. In this night action, the Japanese assault a fortified line of Scouts protected by wire, mortars & SP on boards 16 and 17.

FE 18 The Bear Battalion Attacks, September, 1942: Guadalcanal with all its horror is featured in this night action between the dug in marines and the best the Japanese army has to offer. The Japanese must break through the Marine line and capture Henderson Field on board 38.

FE 19 Lemon Bridge, July 1943: Summer 1943 was a hot time in the Mediterranean. This all-infantry scenario pits the British attacking across boards 16 and 44 to capture some key buildings against the infantry of the Hermann Goering Division.

FE 20 Collision Course, September 1943: This action occurs in the Salerno Bridgehead. Two strong forces smash into each other on board 46 and 11. Both American and German combined arms square off in a fight to the finish.

FE 21 Tiger of Vitebsk, December 1943: The Tiger of Vitebsk, Albert Ernst is featured in this battle from which he earned his sobriquet. In this action three Hornets ambush an attacking force of Russian infantry and tanks. Can the Germans repeat their success where the Tiger killed 14 tanks with 21 shots? The deadly 88's will help! This scenario uses boards 18, 19, 44 and 46.

FE 22 Rampage at Ritpong, May 1944: Despite frequent complaints from the Americans about the slow pace of the Chinese army this battle showed what an aggressive Chinese force could achieve. This action features the Chinese conducting a successful assault against a fortified Japanese village on the road to Mytchinka. This scenario uses boards 32, 36, 38 and 39.

FE 23 Operation Spring, July 1944: Operation Goodwood was a bloody failure for the Allies. The SS troops atop Bourguebus Ridge had stopped the British attack. Operation Spring followed up Goodwood and threw the Canadians at the same ridge adding more bodies and burning wrecks to the battlefield. Can the Canadians break through the board 2 hills across boards 19 and 44?

FE 24 An Unconventional Attack, March 8-9, 1945: It wasnt often that the armor was called upon to attack at night but such was the desperate measures of the German army late in 1945. In this action a lot of heavy metal is called upon to clear dug in Russian defenders from the board 2 hill.

Name: Atacar es Vencer!
Description:
Fields of Battle scenario-campaign set during the Spanish Civil War. The scenarios cover the drive on Madrid early in the SCW. Fields of Battle may be used with other systems.

from the editor website

Name: Plantation
Description:
A card game developed for the Quick Print and Play Design Challenge.  Players take on the role of colonizers seeking to establish plantation empires in the new world.  Adroit placement of sugar, tobacco, gain, indigo, and coffee plantations will yield rich harvests of gold and victory points.  But watch out:  native empires and geographic barriers such as mountain ranges may confound your efforts.

The game is played with a deck of game cards and several kinds of tokens (all of which can be substituted with generic game components such as poker chips).  Each card represents a colony, complete with several plantations.  Players take turns "discovering" colonies (collecting cards), "settling" them (playing cards into their play area), "harvesting" from them (collecting VPs), and taking other actions intended to construct the most effective plantation society.  The key to the game is to place cards in such a fashion that plantations of the same time are adjacent to each other.  Harvesting from these chains of like plantations yields enormous bonuses in victory points.

But watch out, for there are obstacles to overcome.  Harvesting is not cheap, and players must generate the income necessary to produce.  Additionally, geographic barriers cost gold to overcome, while native empires diminish harvest chains.  And pirates lurk nearby, waiting to disrupt the plans of even the cleverest colonial planner.

In the end, the player who most effectively builds and harvests will win the day.

Name: Racers Ready
Description:
Packaged in a giant whistle, Racers Ready presents players with 52 challenges divided into three categories: Time Challenges, Contests, and Races. Playing either as individuals or in teams, players compete in the various challenges – such as building a tower out of oat rings by using tweezers or catching a tennis ball with kitchen tongs – and whoever has the most points after five challenges wins.

A deluxe version of Racers Ready includes 12 additional challenges and an electronic timer. Racers Ready will debut April 2011.

Name: Prime Suspect
Description:
The game begins with each player selecting one of seven secret identities - each a character from the Cogno games and books. The object of the game is to collect five of six character cards that match your secret identity before your opponents collect their cards or can guess who you are.

In this game, players ask their opponents for certain numbers or number ranges to collect the cards they need - while trying to keep their identity hidden. Meanwhile, they keep an eye on what everyone else is requesting in hopes of zeroing in on their opponents.

Name: Eddie Arcaro's Sweepstakes Game
Description: This game, publisher unknown, is a horse racing game endorsed by Arcaro in 1954. It has 4 different racing games included - Round Robin - Win,Place,Show - Point Handicap - Rookie. Each is a dice game with different rules for how you win and includes different betting options.

Name: Imbrix
Description:
Imbrix is an abstract game for two players, consisting in 5 L-tiles of each colour (black and red)

The goal of the game is to be the first player to create a window consisting of an empty square surrounded by tiles.

On his turn, each player either places a new tile of his colour or recovers one tile he previously played to replace it elsewhere, regarding the placing and recovering constraints.

To be valid, a tile should be placed touching other tiles by at least two sides.
To recover a tile, the tile should slide from the others (i.e. not be blocked) without moving the other tiles. Then the player replaces it elsewhere, regarding the placing constraint.

End of the game: If every tiles have been placed and no window created, the players go on by recovering tiles of their colour, until an empty square could be created. The winner is the player who creates this window.

Name: Equinox
Description:
Equinox is an abstract game for two players, consisting of 8 square tiles of each colour (red and black), placed alternately to form a 4x4 square draught-board.

The goal of the game is to be the first to connect seven of the eight squares of ones colour, either horizontaly, verticaly, or even in both directions.

On his turn, each player moves by sliding them one or more connected tiles in the same direction (horizontaly or verticaly), without exceeding a virtual 6x6 square board.

It is forbidden for a player to play backwards the exact previous movement.

Name: Summoner Wars: Goodwin's Blade Reinforcement Pack
Description:
This reinforcement pack is the perfect addition to your Summoner Wars Starter Set and your Vanguards and Fallen Kingdom Faction Decks, allowing you to bring new troops to the War for Itharia, and experience the excitement of deck construction.


Goodwin's Blade Includes: - 35 Cards

Vanguards
•1 Colleen Brighton - Champion
•1 Jacob Eldwyn - Champion
•1 Leah Goodwin - Champion
•5 Angel - Common
•5 Cavalry Knight - Common

Fallen Kingdom
•1 Anica - Champion
•5 Phantom - Common
•5 Reaver - Common
•5 Cultist - Common

Mercenaries
•1 NaanÂ’Nashi - Mercenary Champion
•5 Owl Familiars - Mercenary Common

The circling crows cry out as more warriors join the war. Choose your weapons and prepare for glory!

Name: Summoner Wars: Hawk's Strike Reinforcement Pack
Description:
This reinforcement pack is the perfect addition to your Summoner Wars Starter Set and your Cloaks and Jungle Elves Faction Decks, allowing you to bring new troops to the War for Itharia, and experi­ence the excitement of deck construction.


Hawk's Strike Includes: - 35 Cards

Cloaks 
•1 Hawk - Champion
Â••1 Sin-Sin - Champion
Â••1 The Admiral - Champion
Â••5 Slashers - Common
Â••5 Snipers - Common

Jungle Elves
•1 Kadara - Champion
Â••5 Jungle Guards - Common
Â••5 Elephants - Common
Â••5 Gorillas - Common
Â•
Mercenaries
•1 Grubs - Champion
Â••5 Stonecloaks - Common

Name: BattleTech Field Manual: The Periphery
Description:
From the back of the book:

Beyond the Great Houses of the Inner Sphere lies the untamed Periphery. Filled with young souls seeking adventure and freedom, the Periphery is a watershed for every stripe of humanity. This diversity has spawned powerful Inner Sphere-like political coalitions, roving pirates, one-world lesser powers and bandit kingdoms striving for legitimacy. Wild, uncivilized and deadly, the Periphery is a turbulent frontier where any warrior who dares can be king. 
BattleTech Field Manual: Periphery describes the various factions that make up the Periphery: Magistracy of Canopus, Taurian Concordat, Marian Hegemony, Outworlds Alliance, Circinus Federation, the Lesser Periphery States, Bandit Kingdoms and the Deep Periphery. This sourcebook describes the history, military doctrine, traditions and tactics of each Periphery faction, plus special rules that reflect the exclusive capabilities of each Periphery regiment, as well as new weapons and 'Mechs unique to the Periphery.

User report:

This sequel to the earlier BattleTech: The Periphery (second edition)  is the final volume in the Field Manuals series for BattleTech to be published by FASA. It was also the last expansion to be published by FASA, before the company ceased trading.

This Field Manual is closer to the ComStar Field Manual than the House-specific Field Manuals, in that it covers a variety of different nations and areas of interest.  It was the first sourcebook to effectively treat the Marian Hegemony and Circinus Federation as states equal to the three long-established major Periphery states.

Whereas the other Field Manuals add new high-tech options to BattleTech, the Periphery Field Manual adds a low-tech option instead - the Rocket Launcher - a fairly primitive but dangerous set of one-shot weapons, and adds a fair number of assorted variants to existing 'Mechs that have been adjusted to carry Rocket Launchers as a part of their weapon arsenal.

This sourcebook was originally published by FASA in 2001, but was re-released with a new cover and new product code by FanPro in 2003. Both versions of this sourcebook are out of print, and it hasn't been released in an electronic format by the new license holder, That makes this one of the harder to find Field Manuals.

Name: Monopoly: Northampton Edition
Description:
Edition of Monopoly based on the English town of Northampton, with local streets and places replacing the traditional properties.

From the publisher:
Steeped in a history of shoe-making and the leather industry, Northampton is now a base for some the world's biggest industrial brands which has made it a focal point for business in Britain as well as offering a rich social and cultural side of life. Now you can tour Northampton and all its famous and popular locations with this new edition of Monopoly!

From Abingdon Park to Sixfields Stadium, and from Althorp House to the Guild Hall, it's all up for grabs as you race around the board building a property empire to beat your opponents!

Name: Cadwallon: City of Thieves – Cry Havoc!
Description:
Cry Havoc! Is a free, mini-expansion for Cadwallon: City of Thieves. It features advanced rules and new Equipment cards to make combat even more interesting. In order to use the new Equipment you will also need to download The Inn expansion. The Inn explains how to utilize these new cards.
Cry Havoc! introduces weapons, traps, and spells that stun or wound player characters.

This mini-expansion add yet another twist to how ducats can be claimed. Players now have the option of racing to collect ritual items for the Gods of Cadwallon, and with a bit of luck, earning wealth and even victory! However, beware of the risk it burdens ,as it might just kill off 1 of your gang members....Are you brave enough to venture into the ritual chamber ?

Another main feature of the expansion is the new combat system! Tired of normal hitting each other and moving the other ? Well now you get to stun and wound your enemies, causing them to lose precious time and action points ! This expansion takes the fight in Cadwallon to a whole new level !

Name: Innovation: Echoes of the Past
Description:
Innovation: Echoes of the Past is an expansion for Carl Chudyk's Innovation, released in 2010, that mirrors the construction of the earlier game as both include 110 cards, 105 cards that are divided into different decks (labeled age 1 to age 10) and five cards that show special achievements that can be claimed.  The expansion's 110 cards are all new.

In loose terms, Innovation is a Civilization-style game in which players first have access to low-powered cards in age 1, then build up to more powerful cards in later ages, stacking new acquisitions on old to build the strength of their holdings. Players meld cards, score points and take special actions (called "dogma actions") unique to their cards in play in order to claim achievements. The first player to claim 4-6 achievements, depending on the number of players, wins the game.

Innovation: Echoes of the Past changes game play from the base game in a number of ways. First, there are now two draw decks to get cards from in each age -- players draw Echoes cards or Base cards depending on the contents of their hand. Second, the maximum player count is increased to five.

Third, and most interestingly, Innovation: Echoes of the Past introduces new game mechanisms. With foreshadow, a player can stash a card under his player board, then bring it into play (and use it) on a later turn when he melds a card that's from the same age or a higher one. With echo, when a player takes the dogma action of a card in play, he can receive additional actions showing on that card and any other cards visible in the same stack.

Name: Dawn of Worlds
Description: Dawn of Worlds is a game where a group of players take the role of gods creating a fantasy world.  The game begins with a basic map drawn on a large piece of paper and one player is assigned to record the changes to the map as the game progresses.  Each turn players roll dice to gain points and spend those points to alter the landscape, make creatures or order those creatures to take actions such as build cities or armies.  The game moves through three phases where the costs of various actions change, encouraging players to first create a landscape, then populate it, then order the creatures.

Name: Bhazum: Ksari
Description:
Welcome back to Bhazum!  A city once ruled by the Councils of the four Cliques, now ruled by a lone Ksari.  In this city, who you know is key, and players will draft the best character cards to use to influence the Ksari's Advisors.  Influencing the Advisors is key, but ignoring the Military, Merchants, and Entertainers of the city could lead to your District's downfall.

Ksari takes place over a series of 12 rounds. Each round, players will play cards to strengthen their Districts, persuade the Advisors, and gain Military, Entertainment and Market influence. Each player scores points for the cards in his District, and the player with the greatest District wins the game!

Name: Fornaldar: Nordic Saga
Description:
In ancients times, before the waning of wild magic, Scandia witnessed the struggle for hegemony between the Mundane Alliance and the Fomorian League. From mythical Jotunheim, the Mundane kingdoms of the Southeast, the northern dwelling of Dwarves and to the southern Troll clans, all races would struggle for possession of renowned artifacts, conquest or mere survival.

Fornaldar is a 2 player game based closely on the universe of David Ritchie's "Albion - Land of Faerie". Players maneuver forces across a map covering contemporary Norway, Sweden and Denmark.  Forces engage in ground or naval battles; Heroes clash in one-on-one Trials by Combat  while enchanters use the power of wild magic in  the pursuit of global goals set for the players in each of the two scenarios: "War of the Sampo" and the "Second Northern War" 


Components
One and half 34"x22" full color maps
480 ½ counters
4 Player aid cards
Rulebook

Name: War Game: A Prototype for Peace
Description: This is a 2-player card-driven war game, in that you play cards and use your pieces to remove your opponent's pieces from the territories on the board. When both players no longer have any cards left in their hands, the game is over. How many cards each player will use before they empty their hands, however, is entirely up to him or her. At the end of the game, it is the players who decide who are the winners, and who are the losers. There are opportunities for both competitive and cooperative play, and a single game can have phases where each is present.  Table talk is encouraged, both during and after the game.

Name: Alamo 1836
Description:
Alamo 1836 is a solitaire wargame (but it can eventually be played by two), published in Vae Victis #97 (February 2011), about the key episode of the thirteen days siege of the fort.

The A4 map is divided into areas. The game includes a sheet of 80 counters. Each texan counter represent 10 soldiers or 1 cannon. Each mexican counter represent 80 soldier or 1 cannon. there are also counters for each officer:  Travis, Bowie, Crockett, Santa Anna, Cos, Duque, Romero, Juan Morales.

The player is in charge of Texan defenders of Alamo, The rules manage the actions of the Mexican army.

There is not a limited number of turns: the game ends when all the defender are eliminated. Victory is given by the number of Mexican conters eliminated.

Name: Race for the Galaxy: Alien Artifacts
Description:
Race for the Galaxy: Alien Artifacts is the fourth expansion for Race for the Galaxy and is incompatible with earlier expansions for that game, instead taking the game in a new direction. Race for the Galaxy: Alien Artifacts consists of two parts:


     46 new cards including five new start worlds to add to the base set, plus a set of action cards and start hand for a fifth player.  These can be used without the orb cards.
